original: LITTORIN, Konrad, Direktör, Örebro, f öbr 25/3 81 av skohandl C L o Maria Andersson, gm Anna Åström. Hal, hdlssk. I fma Ernst Littorin fr 02, deläg 13—27, dir öbr expr- & hdlsAB sed. 28. Led planter.nmdn. Styr.ordf öbr l bränslehdlfrn. Lstkapt, ordf öbr Istfrn, led Sv Istfrnars centr.frbs vkst utsk. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Frankr 12. Delt i olymp sp Aten 06, London 08, sv mast i raka hopp 06. KVO2kl, GV:s O1M, LstGM, öbr l Istfrbs GM, öbr l skyt.frbs GM, Sv-GldrRGM, skyt.m g. Hobbies: Botanik, böcker.
translated: LITTORIN, Konrad, Director, Örebro, born on March 25th, 1881, to shoemaker C.L. and Maria Andersson, married to Anna Åström. Completed secondary school. Started working for Ernst Littorin in 1902, became co-owner from 1913 to 1927, and has been the director of the Örebro Express and Trading Company since 1928. Member of the Board of Plant Nurseries. Chairman of the Board for the local fuel trading company. Lieutenant Captain, chairman of the Rifle Association, member of the Swedish Rifle Association's central committee for shooting growth. Traveled to Germany, England, and France in 1912. Participated in the Olympic Games in Athens in 1906, London in 1908, and won the Swedish championship in high jump in 1906. Knight of the Royal Order, First Class, recipient of the Royal Order of Merit, chairman of the Swedish Rifle Association, chairman of the Shooting Association, Swedish Gold Medal in Shooting. Hobbies: Botany, books.
